<td align="left" colspan="10" valign="top" width="54%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;(2) The aggregate intrinsic value is calculated as the difference between the exercise price of the underlying awards</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; and the closing price of the Company's common stock as of June 30, 2011, for those awards that have an</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; exercise price currently below the closing price as of June 30, 2011 of $1.95.</div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" colspan="11" valign="top" width="38%">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;(3) This value is calculated as the difference between the exercise price and the market price of the stock on the date</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" colspan="11" valign="top" width="38%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; of exercise.&#160; The&#160;Company's common stock as of June 30, 2011 (exercise date) was&#160;$1.95 per share.</font></td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><br>
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;The Company issued new shares upon the exercise of the 210,600 stock options exercised in the fiscal year ended June 30, 2011.&#160;&#160;As of June 30, 2011, all Black Scholes values related to above stock</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;options had been expensed.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;ASSETS HELD FOR SALE AND LIABILITIES RELATED TO ASSETS HELD FOR SALE</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In previous SEC filings, Alanco reported three business segments: Data Storage, Wireless Asset Management and RFID Technology.&#160;&#160;During fiscal year ended June 30, 2009, the Company announced a plan to divest the operations of the Company&#8217;s Data Storage segment and reinvest the proceeds in to the remaining operating units.&#160;&#160;The divestiture plan was expanded during the quarter ended September 30, 2009 when the Company announced its plan to sell its RFID Technology segment.&#160;&#160;Finally, the plan was expanded further when, on February 23, 2011, the Company entered into a definitive agreement, subject to shareholder approval, to sell its Wireless Asset Management segment.&#160;&#160;In compliance with the divestiture plan, the Data Storage segment was sold in March 2010 and the RFID Technology segment was sold in August 2010.&#160;&#160;The sale of the Wireless Asset Management segment was approved by shareholders at the Company&#8217;s annual meeting on May 10, 2011, with the transaction closing approximately one week later.&#160;&#160;As a result, as of June 30, 2011 all segment operations had been sold and the segment&#8217;s operating results for the fiscal year ended June 30, 2011 were reported as Discontinued Operations.&#160;&#160;&#160;Prior period activity has been reclassified to report operating segments as discontinued operations and certain balances have been reclassified in the accompanying consolidated financial statements to conform with the current year&#8217;s presentation.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In accordance with the divestiture plan, the Data Storage segment was sold in March 2010, the RFID Technology segment was sold in August 2010 and the sale of the Wireless Asset Management segment was approved by shareholders at the Company&#8217;s annual meeting on May 10, 2011, with the sale effective May 16, 2011.&#160;&#160;As a result, all segment operations were reported as Discontinued Operations for the years ended June 30, 2011 and 2010.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, at June 30, 2011 there were no &#8220;Assets Held for Sale&#8221; or &#8220;Liabilities Related to Assets Held for Sale&#8221;.&#160;&#160;Assets Held for Sale as of June 30, 2010 are presented in the following table and consist of the RFID Technology segment, remaining assets and liabilities of the Data Storage segment and the Wireless Asset Management segment.&#160; The reclassification of those segment's assets and liabilities to&#160;&#8220;Assets Held for Sale&#8221; and &#8220;Liabilities Related to Assets Held for Sale&#8221; does not affect the reported net loss for the periods presented.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">&#160;</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">27</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>

<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>

</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">5.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;SALE OF OPERATING SEGMENTS</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Sale of StarTrak Systems, LLC Operations &#8211; Wireless Asset Management segment</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The operations of StarTrak Systems, LLC (&#8220;StarTrak&#8221;), a wholly owned subsidiary comprising the Company&#8217;s Wireless Asset Management segment, was sold to ORBCOMM Inc. (&#8220;ORBCOMM&#8221;) effective May 16, 2011.&#160;&#160;The transaction was structured as an asset purchase whereby ORBCOMM acquired substantially all of StarTrak&#8217;s assets and liabilities.&#160;&#160;(The Asset Purchase Agreement was included in the definitive proxy statement filed on April 11, 2011.)&#160;&#160;The transaction was considered the sale of substantially all of the assets of Alanco and accordingly required shareholder approval.&#160;&#160;The proposal was approved by shareholders at the annual shareholders meeting held on May 10, 2011 and the transaction closing date was May 16, 2011.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Consideration Received - </font>Total transaction consideration payable at close, including escrowed amounts as required by the agreement, for substantially all of the assets of StarTrak is equal to an aggregate face amount of approximately $17.7 million in cash, ORBCOMM Common and Series A Preferred Stock, Alanco Common and Series E Preferred Stock and the assumption of debt.&#160;&#160;Consideration consists of the following:</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">

<div>

<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 45pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">10.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Assumption by ORBCOMM of certain specified liabilities, generally consisting of liabilities arising after the closing date and liabilities reflected in the closing Working Capital Adjustment (&#8220;WCA&#8221;).</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Escrow accounts</font> - The escrow account for 249,917 shares (number 6 above) of ORBCOMM Common Stock, established under the escrow agreement described above, provides for the availability of ORBCOMM shares to pay for half of the out of pocket costs that may be incurred as a result of certain litigation pending against StarTrak at the time of the closing.&#160;&#160;Subsequent to the closing, a settlement was reached among the litigants and ORBCOMM notified Alanco that its half of the settlement cost, including fees and expenses, amounted to approximately $100,000.&#160;&#160;Under the escrow agreement, shares returned to ORBCOMM in payment of the litigation costs would be valued at $3.001 per share; therefore 33,322 shares would be returned to ORBCOMM in settlement of the litigation costs.&#160;&#160;Upon distribution of the shares to ORBCOMM from the escrow account, the remaining shares would be distributed to Alanco.&#160;&#160;Final distribution of the escrow shares is pending a review by Alanco of legal fees and expenses included by ORBCOMM in the calculations.&#160;&#160;We expect all remaining shares under this escrow agreement to be distributed by October 31, 2011.&#160;&#160;To recognize at June 30, 2011 the potential return of ORBCOMM shares under this agreement, Alanco has reduced the balance of the Marketable Securities &#8211; Restricted by the value of 33,322 shares.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The second escrow account in the amount of 166,611 shares of ORBCOMM common stock, established under item 7 above, provides for the availability of ORBCOMM shares to pay for half of certain product warranty costs incurred during the period March 1, 2011 to April 30, 2012, but only to the extent total warranty costs during the period exceed $600,000.&#160;&#160;Under the escrow agreement, shares returned to ORBCOMM in payment of those warranty costs would again be valued at $3.001 per share.&#160;&#160;Upon distribution of the shares to ORBCOMM from the escrow account, the remaining shares would be distributed to Alanco.&#160;&#160;To recognize at June 30, 2011 the potential return of ORBCOMM shares under this agreement, Alanco has reduced the balance of the Marketable Securities &#8211; Restricted by the value of 83,306 shares.&#160;&#160;The 83,306 shares reduction is based on management's best estimate of the warranty costs at June 30, 2011.&#160; The ultimate number of shares of ORBCOMM Common Stock to be returned to ORBCOMM in the final settlement is currently undeterminable.&#160; Final distribution under this escrow agreement is anticipated to be completed by April 30, 2012, after the warranty costs have been determined for the twelve month period ended April 30, 2012.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES </font>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Working Capital Adjustment</font> - The Agreement also provided compensation for changes in working capital between November 30, 2010 and May 31, 2011, the measurement date, determined in accordance with GAAP consistently applied.&#160;&#160;If working capital, defined as current assets minus current liabilities less long-term deferred revenue, increased over the period, ORBCOMM will pay the value of that increase in cash or additional ORBCOMM Common Stock under number 10 above.&#160;&#160;If the defined working capital decreased during the period, Alanco will return that amount from ORBCOMM Common Stock, valued at $3.001 per share, issued under number 10 above.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">ORBCOMM delivered to Alanco on August 12, 2011, a written statement of the Current Assets, Current Liabilities and Net Working Capital Amount pursuant to the terms of the Agreement reflecting a working capital adjustment in favor of ORBCOMM of approximately $700,000.&#160;&#160;Under terms of the Agreement, Alanco submitted a &#8220;Notice of Disagreement&#8221; of the Net Working Capital Amount submitted by ORBCOMM.&#160;&#160;The Agreement stipulates third party arbitration to resolve disagreements over the working capital adjustment.&#160;&#160;In an attempt to avoid the expense of submitting the disagreement to arbitration prematurely, and in consideration of mutual desires to resolve the issue, the parties agreed to extend the resolution period to November 24, 2011 and are working to resolve the issue.&#160;&#160;The Company has recorded a reserve in excess of $100,000 for this contingent liability as of June 30, 2011.&#160;&#160;However, based upon the limited documentation received from ORBCOMM to date, we cannot reasonably estimate the likelihood of additional liability.&#160;&#160;Although we believe our reserve to be adequate, the ultimate liability may be materially revised as we continue to work to resolve the matter.&#160;&#160;As of the filing of this Form 10-K, the parties were reviewing the working capital calculations and no resolution had been reached.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.9pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Fair Value of Financial Instruments</font> &#8211; The estimated fair values for financial instruments are determined at discrete points in time based on relevant market information.&#160;&#160;The Series E Convertible Preferred Stock (&#8220;Series E&#8221;) referred to in number 4 above was issued originally to ORBCOMM, at the time a supplier of StarTrak, by Alanco in April 2010 in a private placement offered to accredited investors.&#160;&#160;ORBCOMM invested $2.25 million in exchange for 500,000 shares ($4.50 per share stated value) of Series E Convertible Preferred Stock.&#160;&#160;Upon receipt of the Series E by Alanco, the shares were immediately retired with no gain or loss recognized.&#160;&#160;The fair value measurement of the Series E is based upon unobservable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are significant to the fair value of the asset and thus represents a Level 3 fair value measurement.&#160;&#160;As discussed in Footnote 12 &#8211; Shareholders&#8217; Equity, the Company exchanged the ORBCOMM Series A Preferred Stock that it received from the sale of the StarTrak Operations with the Company&#8217;s Series E Convertible Preferred Stock held by primarily unrelated third parties of an equal stated value.&#160;&#160;The Company estimated the fair value of the Series E Convertible Preferred Stock that it received from the sale of StarTrak Operations based upon the value of the ORBCOMM Series A Preferred Stock, which valuation is discussed below.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.9pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 1,212,748 shares of Alanco&#8217;s Class A Common Stock (&#8220;Class A&#8221;) received per number 5 above were valued at $1.03 per share, which approximates the trading price on May 16, 2011.&#160;&#160;Alanco Class A Common stock was traded at the time under the NASDAQ Capital Markets under the trading symbol &#8220;ALAN&#8221;.&#160;&#160;The fair value measurement is based on quoted prices for identical assets traded in active markets, and thus represents a Level 1 fair value measurement.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.9pt" align="justify"><br>
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The total of 2,237,111 shares of ORBCOMM Common Stock (<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NASDAQ: ORBC</font>) valued at $2.91 per share (closing price at May 16, 2011) discussed in items 6 through 8 above are registered under a currently effective ORBCOMM Form S-3 registration statement.&#160;&#160;Under the terms of the Agreement, the Company is limited to selling up to 279,638 shares (12 &#189;% of the total shares) per month.&#160;&#160;The sale restriction discussed above is why the fair value measurement of June 30, 2011 of ORBCOMM's Stock is based on quoted prices for similar assets in active markets, that are either directly or indirectly observable and thus represent a Level 2 measurement.&#160; However, management does not believe the restriction will interfere with any plans to market their stock holdings.&#160; As such, the trading price is used as fair value with no further adjustment.&#160; The remaining shares will be revalued at the end of each reporting period with per share market value fluctuations reported as&#160;Comprehensive Income&#160;(Loss) for the period.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">ORBCOMM also issued 183,550 new shares of ORBCOMM Series A ($10.00 per share stated value) Convertible Preferred Stock, per item 9 above, valued at $1,835,500.&#160;&#160;The $1,835,500 stated value represented the identical stated value of Alanco outstanding Series D and Series E Preferred Stock.&#160;&#160;Upon receipt of the ORBCOMM preferred stock, Alanco immediately offered the Series A Preferred Shares to Alanco&#8217;s remaining Series D and Series E Preferred shareholders on an equal exchange based on stated values.&#160;&#160;The offer was</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">31</font></div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES </font>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">accepted by all remaining Series D and Series E Preferred shareholders resulting in the retirement of all of Alanco&#8217;s outstanding Series D and Series E Convertible Preferred Stock prior to June 30, 2011.&#160;&#160;The face value of the ORBCOMM Series A Convertible Preferred Stock is $1,835,500 and the estimated fair value is approximately $1,833,000.&#160;&#160;The fair value measurement is based upon observable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are significant to the fair value of the asset and thus represents a Level 3 fair value measurement.&#160;&#160;To estimate the fair value of the ORBCOMM Series A Convertible Preferred Stock, the Company used a valuation model which is based on both a market and income approach.&#160;&#160;The significant inputs for the valuation model include the following:</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div align="center">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="23%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.7pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Annual dividend yield</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="6%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.7pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">4%</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.7pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Discount rate</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="6%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.7pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">8.5%</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.7pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Expected volatility</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="6%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.7pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">73%</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.7pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Expected term</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="6%">

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="8%">

</td>
<td valign="top" width="6%">

</td>

</td>

</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;The difference between the recorded face value and the estimated fair value is immaterial and no adjustment was recorded.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></font></font></div>

<div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 5px">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td width="1240">
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Contingent Earn Out Amount - </font>In addition to the Closing Consideration discussed above, up to an additional amount of approximately $1.17 million in contingent payments (the &#8220;Earn Out Amount&#8221;) is payable to Alanco by ORBCOMM if certain revenue milestones of the StarTrak business are achieved for the 2011 calendar year (the &#8220;Earn-Out Period&#8221;), ranging from approximately $194,000 in payout for total revenue of $20 million in the Earn-Out Period to approximately $1.17 million from total revenue of $24 million in the Earn-Out Period.&#160;&#160;&#160;Any contingent payments earned can be paid in common stock, cash or a combination at ORBCOMM&#8217;s option.&#160;&#160;Any ORBCOMM common shares issued will be valued on the 20-day average closing price ending March 31, 2012.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-STYLE: normal; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><br>
</font></font></font></font></div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of the acquisition date, the fair value of the contingent earn-out was estimated to be nil.&#160;&#160;The estimated fair value of the earn-out was determined using the probability of achieving the revenue milestones.&#160;&#160;The fair value measurement is based on significant inputs not observed in the market and thus represents a Level 3 measurement.&#160;&#160;Any change in the fair value of the contingent earn-out subsequent to the acquisition date, including changes from events after the acquisition date, will be recognized in the period the estimated fair value changes.</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;StarTrak Book Value</font> <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">and Gain on Sale</font> - Assets and liabilities acquired by ORBCOMM in the StarTrak transaction and representing net book value amounted to $15,252,500 are presented below:</font></div>

<br>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Based upon the transaction consideration discussed above, estimated potential obligations of the Company under the escrow agreements and working capital adjustments, transaction costs and</font></div>

<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;net book value of assets </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">sold,&#160;the resulting gain on the sale of StarTrak Systems, LLC operations, as presented below, is $1,294,000.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">33</font></div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES </font>

<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">&#160;</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Sale of Alanco/TSI PRISM, Inc. Operations &#8211; RFID Technology segment</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font><br>
&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On August 18, 2010, the Company announced the sale of substantially all of the assets and operations of Alanco/TSI PRISM, Inc. (&#8220;TSI&#8221;), an entity representing the Company&#8217;s RFID Technology segment, to Black Creek Integrated Systems Corp. (&#8220;Black Creek&#8221;), a private company located in Irondale, Alabama. (See Form 8-K filed on August 23, 2010 detailing the transaction.)&#160;&#160;The asset purchase transaction had been substantially completed by fiscal 2010 year end with the recording of a $4.5 million goodwill impairment charge and the accrual of the segment&#8217;s operating losses through the August 2010 sales date of $142,200.&#160;&#160;The transaction resulted in no gain or loss from TSI discontinued operations or the sale of assets in fiscal 2011 as the Company had&#160;impaired carrying values in anticipation of the sale.&#160;&#160;The transaction, which closed August 17, 2010, consisted of approximately $2 million in cash, the proceeds of which went directly to secured creditors.&#160;&#160;The Black Creek transaction excluded $1,372,800 of TSI recorded net liabilities and claims (&#8220;Liabilities&#8221;), which remained on the accounts of TSI.&#160;&#160;Since all proceeds from the sale went to secured creditors and the corporation is inactive, TSI does not have the assets or ability to satisfy the remaining Liabilities and Alanco believes it is sheltered from the Liabilities by TSI&#8217;s corporate structure, the stock of which was sold to an independent third party in June 2011 for an immaterial amount.&#160;&#160;Given these facts and circumstances and discussion with legal counsel, Alanco believes that it has no exposure for these Liabilities, therefore, at June 30, 2011, the Company excluded those Liabilities from its consolidated accounts and recognized $1,372,800 in income from the dissolution&#160;of the subsidiary.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Sale of Excel/Meridian Data, Inc. &#8211; Data Storage segment</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company sold its Data Storage assets and operations, effective February 28, 2010, to an entity controlled by Shackleton Equity Partners (&#8220;Buyer&#8221;), an investment banking group, located in Los Angeles, California.&#160;&#160;The Buyer acquired substantially all of the assets (excluding accounts receivable and certain inventories deemed obsolete by the Buyer) and assumed substantially all of the liabilities in the transaction.&#160;&#160;The net book value of assets sold, net of liabilities assumed by Buyer, amounted to $110,200. The Buyer had agreed to collect the accounts receivable balances retained by the Company and hold on a consignment basis the non-purchased inventory.&#160;&#160;Payment was due to the Company as the receivables were collected and as the inventory was used.&#160;&#160;During the quarter ended December 31, 2010, the Buyer ceased operations and notified the Company that it was insolvent and unable to pay the amounts due under the agreement.&#160;&#160;As a result, the Company recorded additional receivable and inventory reserves in the fiscal year ended June 30, 2011 of $99,800 to reflect Buyer&#8217;s inability to make payment, resulting in a ($99,800) loss for fiscal 2011 in the Data Storage segment.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A patent infringement claim was filed by Crossroads Systems, Inc. against Excel/Meridian in 2010.&#160; As the Company was in the process of selling the assets of Excel/Meridian, management determined that no defense against the claim was necessary given the liquidation of the Company.&#160; As such, Crossroads Systems, Inc. was awarded a default judgment in the approximate amount of $400,000.&#160; Excel/Meridian has no assets to satisfy the obligation and pursuant to our discussions with legal counsel, it does not appear that Crossroads Systems, Inc. has any recourse due to Excel/Meridian&#8217;s corporate structure, the stock of which was sold to an independent third party in June 2011 for an immaterial amount.&#160; Given these facts and circumstances, Alanco believes that it has no exposure to the judgment or other potential Excel liabilities and&#160;as such, no liabilities have been recorded in the accompanying financial statements at June 30, 2011.&#160;</font></div>

<div>&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">6.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;MARKETABLE SECURITIES &#8211; RESTRICTED</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 36pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27.35pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Marketable Securities &#8211; Restricted at year end in the amount of $6,637,100 represent the June 30, 2011 market value ($3.13 per share) of 2,237,111 ORBCOMM Common Shares (<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NASDAQ: ORBC</font>) received as partial consideration in the May 16, 2011 sale of StarTrak, less an estimated 116,628 shares to be returned to ORBCOMM for settlement of obligations under the escrow agreements more fully discussed in Note 5 &#8211; Sale of Operating Segments.&#160;&#160;&#160;The cost basis of these shares at June 30, 2011 is $6,170,600.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>
</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The ORBCOMM common shares are registered under a currently effective ORBCOMM Form&#160;S-3 registration statement, however under the terms of the Agreement, the Company is limited to selling up to 279,638 shares (12 &#189;% of the shares received) monthly.&#160;&#160;The Company has classified these securities as available-for-sale at June 30, 2011. The fair value measurement at June 30, 2011 is based upon quoted prices from similar assets in</font></div>

<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></div>

</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: -0.7pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">active markets and thus represents a Level 2 measurement.&#160;&#160;The restriction discussed above is why ORBCOMM&#8217;s Stock trading price is deemed a Level 2 input.&#160;&#160;However, management does not believe the restriction will interfere with any plans to market their stock holdings.&#160;&#160;As such, the trading price is used as fair value with no further adjustment.&#160;&#160;The remaining shares will be revalued at the end of each reporting period with per share market value fluctuations reported as&#160;Comprehensive Income&#160;(Loss) for the period.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At June 30, 2011, $1.8 million of the June 30, 2010 balance due under the Notes Payable &#8211; Trust had been repaid and the $3.9 million remaining balance was assumed by ORBCOMM, with approval of the Trust, under the May 16, 2011 agreement whereby ORBCOMM acquired the assets and operations of StarTrak.&#160;&#160;The Trust Agreement, in effect since 2002, was terminated upon the assumption of the debt by ORBCOMM.&#160;&#160;See Note 5 for additional discussion on the sale of StarTrak and additional discussion on the assumption of debt by ORBCOMM.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The $500,000 Notes payable &#8211; ComVest Capital at June 30, 2010 was repaid during fiscal year 2011 as per the terms of the note.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Notes payable &#8211; Other<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">,</font> at June 30, 2011, represents an unsecured note issued to the Company&#8217;s Chief Financial Officer.&#160;&#160;The note is a 10 day convertible demand note in the amount of $28,000, bearing interest at 8% per annum, issued for additional working capital.&#160;&#160;The $28,000 note is convertible into Class A Common Stock at $2.24 per share.&#160;&#160;A second demand note was outstanding at June 30, 2010 issued to the Company&#8217;s Chief Executive Officer for additional working capital in the in the amount of $100,000, bearing interest at 12% per annum.&#160;&#160;During fiscal 2011, the Chief Executive Officer increased the note balance to $200,000, again for working capital.&#160;&#160;The second note was repaid during the fiscal year ended June 30, 2011.&#160;&#160;See Note 10 &#8211; Related Party Transactions for additional information.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<td valign="top" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="7%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(17,940,000)</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="22%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="7%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
<td valign="top" width="7%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Net deferred tax</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">$</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="7%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: right">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">-</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">$</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="7%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN: right">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">-</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><br>
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><br>
</font>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A valuation allowance is recognized if it is more likely than not that some or all of the deferred income tax assets will not be realized.&#160;&#160;A valuation allowance is used to offset the related income tax assets due to uncertainties of realizing the benefits of certain net operating loss and tax credits.&#160;&#160;The valuation allowance reflects a 100% reserve for all years reported above.&#160;&#160;At June 30, 2011, the Company had net operating loss and capital loss carry-forwards for federal tax purposes of approximately $48,000,000.&#160;&#160;The loss carry-forwards, unless utilized, will expire from 2012 through 2031.&#160;&#160;With few exceptions, the Company is no longer subject to U.S. federal, state and local examinations by tax authorities for years before 2007.</font></font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Internal Revenue Code Section 382 limits the ability to utilize net operating losses if a 50% change in ownership occurs over a three year period.&#160;&#160;Such limitation of the net operating losses may have occurred which the Company has not fully analyzed at this time as the deferred tax asset is fully reserved.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">10.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On October 6, 2009, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors modified certain warrants, scheduled to expire on November 16, 2009, to purchase 37,500 shares of the Company&#8217;s Class A Common Stock (issued in a previous preferred stock offering), by reducing the exercise price from $10.00 to $4.00 per share.&#160;&#160;Warrants to purchase 11,300 Class A Common Shares, or 30%, were held by officers and directors of the Company.&#160;&#160;Prior to expiration, the Company extended the expiration date of the warrants to November 16, 2010.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s subsidiary, StarTrak Systems, LLC, obtained certain software engineering services from ST Wireless, a company organized and operating under the laws of India.&#160;&#160;Timothy P. Slifkin, a director of Alanco and past StarTrak president and StarTrak Vice President of Technology, informed the Company that he assisted with the formation of ST Wireless in India.&#160;&#160;ST Wireless has performed these services since the acquisition of StarTrak by Alanco in June 2006.&#160;&#160;For the years ended June 30, 2011 and 2010, StarTrak paid ST Wireless $235,600 and $161,650, respectively, for services performed.&#160;&#160;Mr. Slifkin represented that he has no ownership interest in ST Wireless, nor does he have any option to acquire any interest in ST Wireless, however he does have a relationship with ST Wireless as described in the following paragraph.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">36</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During August 2010, Mr. Slifkin disclosed to Alanco that he owned 60% of the outstanding membership interests of August Matrix, LLC, a New Jersey limited liability company formed in 2008 to represent ST Wireless in the United States.&#160;&#160;Although StarTrak did not make any payment to August Matrix during fiscal years ended June 30, 2011 and 2010 for the years ended June 30, 2009 and 2008, StarTrak paid August Matrix $53,800 and $205,400, respectively,&#160;&#160;&#160;(Mr. Slifkin&#8217;s 60% portion being $32,300 and $123,200).&#160;&#160;Mr. Slifkin further informed the Company that all of the monies paid by StarTrak to August Matrix were, in turn, paid by August Matrix to ST Wireless for the benefit of StarTrak, and that Mr. Slifkin has received no disbursements or compensation from either August Matrix or ST Wireless.&#160;&#160;&#160;Amounts due either ST Wireless or August Matrix at June 30, 2010 or 2009 were not deemed material.&#160;&#160;&#160;On May 16, 2011, the operations of StarTrak were sold to ORBCOMM in a transaction more fully discussed in Note 5 - Sale of Operating Segments.&#160;&#160;Mr. Slifkin&#8217;s term as a director of Alanco had expired on May 10, 2011 and his employment relationship terminated with the StarTrak sale on May 16, 2011, therefore at June 30, 2011, Mr. Slifkin was neither a director nor an executive officer of the Company.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On September 16, 2010, the Board of Directors approved the immediate repricing of substantially all of the outstanding stock options (approximately 866,000 repriced option shares granted to 49 individuals) held by Officers, Directors and employees to $1.50, a 7.9% premium to the closing market price on September 15, 2010 of $1.39.&#160;&#160;Current directors and officers (5 individuals) accounted for 377,025 shares, or 43.5%, of the repriced shares.&#160;&#160;The noncash stock based compensation created by the stock option repricing, as determined under the Black Scholes method, was approximately $298,400, which was expensed during the quarter ended September 30, 2010.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company has had a line of credit agreement (&#8220;Credit Agreement&#8221;) with a private trust (&#8220;Lender&#8221;) controlled by Donald Anderson, who, prior to May 2011, was a greater than five percent stockholder of the Company, and prior to October 4, 2010,&#160;&#160;was a member of the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors.&#160;&#160;The Credit Agreement had been in effect since 2002 and was a major source of working capital for the Company.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In August 2010, upon the completion of the sale of Alanco/TSI PRISM, Inc. operations, the Company repaid $1.8 million of the balance reducing the principal amount due under the Credit Agreement to $3.9 million.&#160;&#160;Under terms of sale to ORBCOMM of the Company&#8217;s Wireless Asset Management operation in May 2011, previously approved by the Lender, ORBCOMM assumed the remaining $3.9 million balance under the Credit Agreement and the Credit Agreement terminated.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Notes payable &#8211; Other balance at June 30, 2011 of $28,000 represents an unsecured note issued to the Company&#8217;s Chief Financial Officer for additional working capital.&#160;&#160;The note is a 10 day convertible demand note, bearing interest at 8% per annum.&#160;&#160;The note is convertible into Class A Common Stock at $2.24 per share.&#160;&#160;Interest was expensed on the note for fiscal years ended June 30, 2011 and 2010 for approximately $2,800 and $300, respectively with approximately $2,400 and $300 in accounts payable at June 30, 2011 and 2010, respectively.&#160;&#160;At June 30, 2010, Notes payable &#8211; other balance of $128,000 included the $28,000 demand note issued to the Chief Financial Officer and a $100,000 note issued to the Company&#8217;s Chief Executive Officer.&#160;&#160;During fiscal 2011, the CEO increased the note balance to $200,000.&#160;&#160;The note, also issued for additional working capital, was unsecured, bears interest at a rate of 12% and was payable within thirty (30) days following written demand for such payment by the holder.&#160;&#160;The note was repaid prior to June 30, 2011.&#160;&#160;Interest was expensed on the note for fiscal years ended June 30, 2011 and 2010 for approximately $15,600 and $3,900, respectively with zero and approximately $3,900 in accounts payable at June 30, 2011 and 2010, respectively.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In February 2011, the Company received unsupported claims and threatened litigation from Tim Slifkin (&#8220;Slifkin&#8221;) and Tom Robinson (&#8220;Robinson&#8221;), a former director and executive officer, respectively, (both former employees of StarTrak) alleging that the Company had not recorded a total of approximately $630,000 of salaries, finder&#8217;s fees and commissions allegedly earned by Slifkin and Robinson and payable at December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;In addition, Slifkin and Robinson claimed that upon the completion of future anticipated transactions they will be owed an additional $335,000 each for a total additional liability of $770,000.&#160;&#160;</font><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">37</font></div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">However, in connection with the ORBCOMM acquisition of the StarTrak assets (which was approved by the Company&#8217;s shareholders at its annual meeting of shareholders held May 10, 2011), the Company entered into a Settlement Agreement and Mutual Release, effective on February 24, 2011, with Tim Slifkin, a member of the Company&#8217;s Board of directors, and Tom Robinson, Executive Vice President of StarTrak Systems, LLC (&#8220;StarTrak&#8221;) and a named executive officer of the Company.&#160;&#160;The agreement provides incentive compensation to Mr. Slifkin and Mr. Robinson in cash and ORBCOMM stock totaling approximately $85,000 each, upon the successful completion of the sale of StarTrak to ORBCOMM, Inc., a transaction discussed in Note 5 &#8211; Sale of Operating Segments of which each was paid $35,000 in cash and with 16,661 shares of ORBCOMM stock being reserved.&#160;&#160;Mr. Slifkin&#8217;s term as a member of the Alanco&#8217;s board expired on May 10, 2011 with the election of new directors.&#160;&#160;The StarTrak employment relationship of both Mr. Slifkin and Mr. Robinson ended with the sale of StarTrak to ORBCOMM on May 16, 2011.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Subsequent to the sale of StarTrak to ORBCOMM, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors approved incentive compensation payments of $354,800 in bonuses, including the $170,000 incentive compensation for Mr. Slifkin and Mr. Robinson and to directors, officers and employees.&#160;&#160;The bonuses were&#160;paid to directors, officers and employees (ten individuals) prior to June 30, 2011.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Alanco 2011 Stock Incentive Plan, more fully discussed in the proxy statement, was approved at the Company&#8217;s Annual Meeting of Shareholders on May 10, 2011.&#160;&#160;The Plan allows for the granting of both Class A Common Stock and stock options.&#160;&#160;One of the purposes of the plan was to give the Company the option to issue certain officers and employees Company stock as payment for salary obligations.&#160;&#160;The obligations were incurred during fiscal year 2011 when certain salaries were reduced to preserve cash.&#160;&#160;The Company issued to five officers and employees, during the period May through June 2011, a total of 298,364 shares of Class A Common Shares with a value of $296,750, as payment of these salary amounts.&#160;&#160;In addition, one director was issued 10,000 shares of Class A Common Stock, valued at $9,800, in payment of incentive compensation related to the sale of StarTrak.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As discussed in Note 12 &#8211; Shareholders&#8217; Equity, during the fiscal year ended June 30, 2011, the Company issued a total of 32,600 shares of Class A Common Stock, valued at $47,700 in payment of Series D Preferred Stock dividends.&#160;&#160;Included were 11,400 shares of Class A Common Stock, or approximately 35%, valued at $16,200, issued to officers and directors of the Company.&#160; Series E Preferred stockholders received cash dividends during the fiscal year ended June 30, 2011 of $51,600, of which $3,400, or 6.6%, was paid to an officer and director of the Company.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As more fully discussed in Note 5 - Sale of StarTrak Systems, LLC Operations &#8211; Wireless Asset Management segment, part of the consideration received in the sale of StarTrak was 183,550 share of Series A Perpetual Convertible Preferred ORBCOMM stock with a total face value of $1,835,500 ($10 per share).&#160;&#160;The stated value represented the identical stated value of Alanco&#8217;s outstanding Series D and Series E Preferred Stock.&#160;&#160;Upon receipt of the ORBCOMM preferred stock, Alanco immediately offered the ORBCOMM Series A Preferred Stock to Alanco&#8217;s remaining Series D and Series E Preferred shareholders on an equal exchange basis based upon stated value.&#160;&#160;The offer was accepted by all remaining Series D and Series E Preferred shareholders, resulting in 183,550 ORBCOMM shares being exchanged for the remaining outstanding Series D and Series E Preferred shares.&#160;&#160;6,657 shares, or 3.6%, were issued to Mr. Robert Kauffman, CEO and Director of the Company, and 10,378 shares, or 5.7%, were issued to Mr. Tom LaVoy, a Director of the Company.&#160;&#160;Mr. Tim Slifkin and Tom Robinson, employees of StarTrak and executive officers of the Company prior to the sale of StarTrak in May 2011, received 13,402 shares, or 7.3%, and 8,613 shares, or 4.7%, respectively.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In June 2011, the Company extended the expiration date of 72,400 stock options by one year incurring an expense of approximately $7,800.&#160;&#160;Stock options totaling 65,600, or 90.6% of the total were options issued to Company directors and officers.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Company paid cash dividends of the Company&#8217;s Series D Preferred Stock totaling approximately $51,600 of which approximately $3,400, or 6.6% was paid to an officer and director of the Company.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ALANCO TECHNOLOGIES, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (continued)</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">11<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Leases &#8211; </font>At June 30, 2011, the Company&#8217;s corporate office was located in an approximate 2,000 square foot facility in Scottsdale, Arizona.&#160;&#160;The space had been part of approximately 9,800 square foot facility previously leased by Alanco/TSI PRISM, Inc. (&#8220;TSI&#8221;) under a multiyear lease that expired on July 31, 2011.&#160;&#160;The TSI lease had been effectively terminated by the sale of TSI assets to Black Creek Integrated Systems Corp. in August 2010.&#160;&#160;Subsequent to that sale, the landlord entered into a new lease with Black Creek and at June 30, 2011, Alanco was using approximately 2,000 square feet under a month to month lease.&#160;&#160;During the fiscal year ended June 30, 2011, the Company&#8217;s former subsidiary, StarTrak Systems, LLC occupied approximately 14,000 square feet of an office/manufacturing facility located in Morris Plains, New Jersey.&#160;&#160;Rent expense related to operating leases totaled approximately $264,300 and $435,700 for the fiscal years ended June 30, 2011 and 2010, respectively.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Alanco moved its corporate offices on July 8, 2011 to 7950 E. Acoma Drive, Suite 111, Scottsdale, Arizona, into an approximately 1,500 square foot facility.&#160;&#160;The new facility was leased at a rate of $1,471 per month under a 13 month lease that expires on July 31, 2012.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Future minimum non-contingent payments as of June 30, 2011 due under the corporate office lease and an office copier lease are $19,100 for fiscal year ended June 30, 2012 and $2,100 in fiscal year 2013 resulting in total future minimum non-contingent payments of $21,200.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font><br>
&#160;<font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Legal Proceedings - </font>The Company&#8217;s subsidiary, StarTrak Systems, LLC has been made a defendant concerning certain patent infringement claims as follows:</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Arrivalstar S.A., et all. v. StarTrak Systems, LLC, et al.&#160; Case No.: 4:10-CV-0033.&#160; This action was a patent infringement action venued in the United States District Court for the Northern District of Indiana.&#160; StarTrak believes that the plaintiff&#8217;s patents are invalid due to prior art, based, in part, upon the substantial commercial activity concerning the patent claims long before the patents were applied for or issued.&#160;&#160;However, StarTrak has resolved the action by agreeing to pay $70,000 for fourteen monthly payments of $5,000 each, thus avoiding substantially greater expenses that would be incurred in defending the action.&#160; This liability has been assumed by ORBCOMM.&#160;</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Innovative Global Systems LLC v. StarTrak Systems, LLC, et al.&#160; Case No.: 6:10-CV-00327.&#160; This action is another patent infringement action venued in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Texas.&#160; Again, StarTrak believes that the plaintiff&#8217;s patents are invalid due to prior art, based, in part, upon the substantial commercial activity concerning the patent claims long before the patents were applied for or issued.&#160;Similarly, StarTrak has resolved the action by agreeing to pay $77,500, with a like amount to be paid by ORBCOMM, thus avoiding substantially greater expenses than would be incurred in defending the action.&#160;&#160;See Note 5 &#8211; Sale of Operating Segments for additional discussion on escrow accounts.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">StarTrak has been served with a Third-Party Complaint by Great American Lines, Inc. and related parties in a lawsuit against them by certain freight shippers in the US District Court for the District of New Jersey, being Case No. 3:10-ev-02023-JAP-TJB.&#160;&#160;The main case against Great American Lines involves allegations concerning a stolen trailer containing freight owned by the plaintiffs resulting in a cargo loss estimated by Great American Lines at $8.8 million.&#160;&#160;Great American Lines has brought its Third-Party Complaint against StarTrak alleging that StarTrak breached its contract with Great American Lines to allow Great American Lines to track its trailer and for indemnity.&#160;&#160;StarTrak has tendered its defense in the lawsuit to its insurance company, which has accepted defense of the action under a reservation of rights declaration. The Company&#8217;s management believes that the suit is without merit and the Company will vigorously defend itself in the matter.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company may also, from time to time, be involved in litigation arising from the normal course of business.&#160; As of June 30, 2011, there was no other such litigation pending deemed material by the Company.</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">&#160;</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">39</font></div>
